intro: Koeleria flavovirens, commonly known as the yellow-green koeleria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are usually yellow or greenish in color, which help it attract pollinators. It has narrow, grass-like leaves that are adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Koeleria flavovirens is often found in meadows and on slopes, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
